easy.translation[0].definitions[0].defin: not difficult to do, and not needing much effort
as easy as pie/ABC/falling off a log (=very easy)
easy.translation[0].definitions[0].examp: Finishing the task will not be easy.
There must be an easier way to do that.
Having you here does make things a lot easier  for me.
The station is within easy reach of  (=close to) the town centre.
The park is within easy walking distance (=close enough to walk to).
The software makes it easier to download music.
It’s a great car, and very easy to drive.
instructions that are easy to follow
It would have been easy for the team to lose the game.
easy.translation[0].definitions[1].defin: comfortable or relaxed, and without problems
easy.translation[0].definitions[1].examp: On the whole, Dad has had an easy life.
You can have an easy time of it now that the kids have all left home.
Why don’t we make life easy for ourselves and finish it tomorrow?
She had a nice easy day at home.
easy.translation[0].definitions[2].examp: We talk more openly when we feel easy and relaxed.
I can leave the children with my mother with an easy mind.
easy.translation[0].definitions[3].defin: friendly and pleasant with other people
easy.translation[0].definitions[3].examp: She is gentle and easy to be with.
easy.translation[0].definitions[4].defin: able to be hunted or attacked without difficulty
easy.translation[0].definitions[4].examp: The soldiers on the streets are an easy target for terrorists.
Tourists are easy prey for thieves.
easy.translation[0].definitions[5].defin: someone, especially a woman, who is easy has a lot of sexual partners
easy.translation[0].note_box[0].sections: easy
not difficult to do, and not needing much effort
an easy task
The house was easy to find.
easy and not complicated – used about things such as instructions and explanations, or about machines and systems
The system is relatively simple to operate.
a simple recipe for chocolate cake
straightforward
easy to understand or do, and unlikely to cause you any problems
a straightforward explanation
The calculation is fairly straightforward.
user-friendly
easy to use – used especially about computers or written information about how to do something
Their website is very user-friendly.
a user-friendly guide to owning a dog
undemanding
easy because it does not take a lot of effort
It was an undemanding role for someone of his experience.
cushy
a cushy job is easy to do and needs very little effort – often used when you are envious of the person who has it
It’s a pretty cushy job – all she has to do is drive a nice car around.
a cushy number (=a very easy job)
mindless
so easy that you can do it without thinking – used especially when it makes you feel bored
mindless tasks
painless
without any difficulties or problems – used especially when you expected something to be much worse
Finding the carhire place at the airport was relatively painless.
Thankfully, there's a wide selection of search tools to make the task relatively painless.
be plain sailing
to be easy and with no problems that you have to deal with
Things should be plain sailing from now on.
informal phrases meaning very easy
be a piece of cake
to be very easy to do, especially compared to doing something else
This test was a piece of cake compared to the last one.
be child’s play
to be surprisingly easy, or much easier than something else which is very difficult or dangerous
Getting people’s credit card details is child’s play when you know how to do it.
Climbing in England is child’s play compared to climbing in the Himalayas.
be a breeze
to be very easy to do
The software is a doddle to use.
The check-in process was a breeze.
it’s not rocket science
used when saying that something is very easy to do or understand, and you do not need to be intelligent to do it
Making your PC run faster isn’t exactly rocket science.
easy.translation[2].definitions[0].defin: if you buy something on easy terms, you pay for it with several small payments, rather than paying the whole amount at once
easy.translation[2].definitions[0].examp: Farmers can obtain credit on very easy terms from government sources.
easy.translation[2].definitions[1].defin: when prices are easier, they are slightly lower
easy.translation[2].definitions[1].examp: Gold was slightly easier yesterday, ending in London at $362.50 an ounce.
easy.translation[2].definitions[2].defin: having all the money you need
easy.translation[2].definitions[2].examp: The $2 million he has to invest will produce enough money to keep him on easy street for the rest of his life.
